Package net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class JavaProcess

  • Object
    • JavaProcess
  • public class JavaProcess
extends Object
    The class whose main method is run as a separate process by the Java process pool executor.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  JavaProcess.InputDecodingException
      An exception class for when the decoding of a line printed to the Java process' standard in stream fails.
      static class  JavaProcess.Response
      A simple class to encapsulate the response of the Java process to a request.
      static class  JavaProcess.ResponseType
      An enum representing types of responses that the Java process can send back to the parent process.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      JavaProcess()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void exit()
      Invoking this method from within a task results in the main method exiting upon the iteration following the execution of the task.
      static void main​(String[] args)
      The method executed as a separate process.

      • Methods inherited from class Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • JavaProcess

        public JavaProcess()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(String[] args)
        The method executed as a separate process. It listens to its standard in for encoded and serialized Callable instances, which it decodes, deserializes, and executes on receipt. The return value is normally output to its stdout stream in the form of the serialized and encoded return values of the Callable instances. If an exception occurs, it is serialized, encoded, and output to the stdout stream as well.
        Parameters:
        args - They are ignored for now.

      • exit

        public static void exit()
        Invoking this method from within a task results in the main method exiting upon the iteration following the execution of the task.
